page.title: 09HAYDON BRIDGE HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: The school serves one of the largest catchment areas in England, 600 sq.miles, total population 10,000. The School's roots go back to{1685}when Rev.John{Shaftoe}signed a Trust Deed to found a Free Grammar School in Haydon Bridge. In 1985 we have 710 pupils, incl. from Sept.90 boarders. This year about 30 pupils will take Degrees & 99% of pupils aged 16+ took public exams. The School has a{farm}of 74 hectares. Some 400 pupils study Agriculture or Horticulture as part of their education. Outdoor activities are a feature. In 1982 the Under 15 Cricket XI was 2nd. in the Lord's Taverners Cup out of 2000 entries. Former pupils have run for England. With respect, we think that our School is the special feature of our Domesday block.
